subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
Two possible interpretations:
* {{liushu|i}} – three small dots > small.
* {{liushu|p}} – three granules of sand – original character of {{och-l|沙}} > small.

Starting from some bronze inscriptions, the dots have become elongated. Based on this form, ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' erroneously considers it to be an {{Han compound|八|丨|ls=ic|nocap=1|t1=to divide; to separate|t2=small object}}.

Compare with {{och-l|少}}, represented by four dots in its oracle bone script form.
